comments:
Hi,
I'm getting the following error when building my targets on CDT 2.1.0 and 
2.1.1 (I dont get any of these exceptions in the previous version 2.0.2 of CDT)
This error is found only on HP-UX. There is no problem in Linux and Windows. I 
create a target using Create Make Target and build the target using Build Make 
Target.

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no spawner in java.library.path
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1516)
        at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:788)
        at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:834)

(ProcessFactory.java:35)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.spawner.ProcessFactory.getFactory
(ProcessFactory.java:47)

(EnvironmentReader.java:49)

(CommandLauncher.java:67)

(MakeBuilder.java:147)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.make.core.MakeBuilder.build(MakeBuilder.java:76)

        at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.build

        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.build(Project.java:81)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.make.internal.core.MakeTarget$1.run
(MakeTarget.java:160)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run

        at org.eclipse.cdt.make.internal.core.MakeTarget.build

        at org.eclipse.cdt.make.ui.TargetBuild$2.run(TargetBuild.java:94)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run
